fields.description:
== Feature being used ==\\
Editing a wiki page - trying to change the path of an existing page.

== Expected behaviour ==\\
Clicking inside of the path text input, I would be able to change the value and hit save, changing the path at which the wiki page could be found.

== Actual behaviour ==\\
Text in the input is selectable, but text cannot be added, changed or deleted.

This was confusing enough that I tried several different browsers and restarted my computer before thinking to check the HTML, and sure enough the input has readonly="True".

== Suggestion ==\\
Either:

* enable page path changes through the web interface (they're possible when working on the wiki source directly, after all)
* don't show readonly fields as an input
* show an explanation / warning that the input contents are non-editable
fields.summary: Confusing UI for readonly wiki page paths (BB-3113)
Keyboard shortcuts are broken

fields.description: I wonder if a new language could be included with the repository options. I recently began using bitbucket and have created a project based on the ABAP programming language.  Could ABAP be added to the available language options?
fields.summary: ABAP as repository language (BB-3125)

fields.description: Just that, see screenshot.

fields.description: If I replace an existing download by adding another download of the same name, there is no indication that it worked. The date field is no longer updated (it use to be a few weeks ago). The date field should represent that last download date as it provides a way to tell that it represents a deliverable matching commit source.
fields.summary: No success indicator on adding download, date not updated (BB-3101)

fields.description:
When Bitbucket sends out an issue change notification. The email\\
contains the following footer.

h2. {{{\\
Responsible:\\
userdave
This is an issue notification from bitbucket.org. Blah blah blah\\
}}}

Anyhow, that isn't very easy to filter when using Gmail, notmuch, etc. It's just not something that's easy to specify using tokens.

It would be awesome - if the email messages contained a parseable token, something like this:

h2. {{{\\
responsible-userdave
This is an issue notification from bitbucket.org. Blah blah blah\\
}}}

Just as readable by a developer. But, can be filtered by Gmail. It isn't currently possible to filter by this line, because Gmail, Outlook, etc cant match something that contains a newline character.
fields.summary: Gmail parseable token in email notifications (BB-3142)

fields.description:
Hi everybody! i noticed that forking a mercurial repo with bitbucket, doesn't inherit in the new fork current issues and tracker settings.

Well, that's probably because unresolved issues aren't linked to any commit and components/milestones too, so it's not possibile to determine what issue/component/milestone inherite and what not.

So maybe an import/export feature it will more easy to achieve and will help people that needs all the old settings in the new fork.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Issues tracker import/export (BB-1473)

fields.description:
At the moment I have about 3 pages of repositories. I'm starting to forget how I named certain stuff.

So I'm using the 'find a project' feature a lot these days. But I keep seeing stuff that's not relevant for the projects I'm working on.\\
Would it be possible to implement a setting in the personal settings to disable searching in public repositories and just search in the repositories I have explicit access to?

(I do think this will also require a checkbox somewhere to temporarily disable this behavior...)
fields.summary: Create setting to only search private repositories (BB-39)

So when I see the commit history on BitBucket, I see checkins made from username(of my computer)@ComputerFullName instead of my username on my BitBucket account
fields.summary: Incorrect Author name while Pushing code to BitBucket repository

fields.description:
I'm trying to clone a repository using this command:\\
{{{\\
sudo git clone git@bitbucket.org:ianwalter/slimming-stem.git\\
}}}

I'm getting the following error:\\
{{{\\
Cloning into slimming-stem...\\
Permission denied (publickey).\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly\\
}}}

The public key under my /home/username/.ssh/id_rsa.pub\\
seems to be the same as the one I've added to my account settings so I'm not sure why I'm getting denied.

Thanks,\\
Ian
fields.summary: Permission denied (publickey).

Hello. I configured Jenkins service integration on my repository which is\\
https://bitbucket.org/itanywhere/jcf-iam. my jenkins endpoint url is https://haibane.ci.cloudbees.com and project name is JCF-IAM . I just typed full url with token on browser then build was successfully started. so  Jenkins has no problem. but bitbucket useing service integration never has  made my jenkins build started. so I guess Jenkins Service integration has a problem. please look at this problem. and reply me. thanks for reading this.

Best regards
fields.summary: Problem with Jenkins services integration (BB-3063)

fields.description:
Hi,

When you view your account's dashboard, your repositories are listed on the right hand side of the page; the heart icon (following project) is shown along with an open  or closed lock (public/private status).  Is there some way that you can also show what type of repository (Git/Mercurial) each project uses?  That way, we can tell with a glance which tool we would use to clone that repository without clicking into that repository's "homepage".

Thanks,

Brian
fields.summary: Show the type of repository (Git/Mercurial) on the dashboard listing of repos (BB-3065)

fields.description:
Hi,

It would be cool if it was possible to submit pull requests from Bitbucket to other big DVCS hosting sites. This would of course require collaboration with them.

I'm thinking of a system where GitHub can send a request to a URL at Bitbucket with information about the GitHub repository and branch to pull. Bitbucket would then present this like a normal pull request (maybe even do the pull into a temporary repository so that you can show the diff) and if the user approves the request, the pull is done.

Comments on the pull request should probably be directed back to the original site.

This was discussed here first: https://plus.google.com/108957994038017966408/posts/PaB9jVuEkwt
fields.summary: Remote pull requests to GitHub, etc (BB-3054)

fields.description:
Right now the newsfeed says something like:

{Person}...\\
commented on issue #{issue number} in {project name}\\
updated issue #{issue number} in {project name}

This is a little bit too scarce for me. I can never remember what each issue number is about.

What if the same change-items as those that are displayed under each issue were displayed in the newsfeed?
fields.summary: Newsfeed should display issue title and other info, same as under each issue (BB-2821)
Commit changes page - markup is broken slightly (screenshot attached)

fields.description:
I pasted a small clip of CSS into an issue tracker comment, inside a block level {{{{{{}}}}}} code block. It displays a hex colour code like so: {{{# 99ab50}}} (no space) appears as {{{<<issue 99>>ab50}}}, even though it is inside a no-format block.

On editing the comment, I discovered that it is still stored as I typed it, therefore the conversion to {{{<<issue 99>>}}} must happen on rendering.

*EDIT:* it obviously happens on inline no-format blocks as well (but doesn't occur in the preview box before posting).
fields.summary: Issue link renderer is too eager and will try to render color hashes (BB-3038)

fields.description:
I'd like to leverage the commit hooks to update an issue in between its completion and when the issue has been resolved.

The purpose of this is for multiple contributor projects where a code screening or review process must take place.

This hook should allow a contributor to complete an issue and have another contributor assigned to review the issue, this reviewer determines if the issue should be resolved and closed.

An example commit message:\\
review/needsreview/assign/needswork cwdesautels BCLOUD-123 added a feature
fields.summary: add review commit hooks

fields.description:
https://bitbucket-assetroot.s3.amazonaws.com/

I was able to access a private repo's (may have been - but I didn't have access anyhow) files.
fields.summary: Possible exploit?

fields.description:
When trying to create an issue via the API, the authenticated user needs a minimum of read privilege on the repo in order to create the issue.

When the repo is private, and the issue tracker is public the user should only be required to be authenticated, not to have read access to the repo.

Instead, an http error 401 is returned from the API if the user does not have read access.
fields.summary: API Create issue, Privare repo, Public issue (BB-3043)
Delete a remote git branch over ssh give error message (BB-2997)

fields.description:
It would be very useful to have a date filter on the query builder. That way you would be able to generate a report for testers' weekly work automatically.

It would be specially helpful if the filter allowed to specify the number of days from the current day. That way, you would only have to generate the query once and would always get the dynamic report.
fields.summary: Add date filter to issue query builder (BB-3020)

fields.description:
I have several Git repositories setup that use submodules to reference in libraries from my other repositories.  When I choose the "get source" option from my repository page (on https://bitbucket.org/cwbaker/sweet_build_tool for example) the packaged source contains the files included in the main repository but it doesn't include any files from the repositories referenced in as submodules.

It'd be nice for me if I could have that "get source" option also bring down the files in the submodules and include them in the source archive.

Thanks,\\
Charles.
fields.summary: Include submodules in source downloads (BB-3011)

fields.description: The download page allows you to upload custom artifacts for your repo. This is not available through the api. To script this, you currently have to reverse engineer the form on the download page and post directly to it. This is a hassle as it's posting straight to S3 and requires 6 hidden fields, one of which is a one-time key.
fields.summary: Add custom file uploads to REST API (BB-1315)
Only repository owner should see follow events (BB-3007)

fields.description:
The reset stylesheet makes HTML dictionary lists confusing (e.g., in rendered reStructuredText).  Often the only distinction between the dt and dd elements is the indentation - most browsers put a 40px margin-left on dd - but the reset CSS eliminates that.  Could you add some kind of margin to the site's CSS for dd, or at least for dl.docutils>dd?

Thanks! :)
fields.summary: css: dd element called, wants its margin back (BB-3021)
Issue Tracker hook creates duplicate issue log entries (BB-3003)

fields.description:
Unfortunately I am getting an error when trying to push my commit's to my bitbucket repository:\\
{{{\\
#!bash

$ git push\\
Password:\\
To https://SamuelMarks@bitbucket.org/SamuelMarks/toc-and-header-footer-extraction-from-pdfs.git\\
! [rejected]        master -> master (non-fast-forward)\\
error: failed to push some refs to 'https://SamuelMarks@bitbucket.org/SamuelMarks/toc-and-header-footer-extraction-from-pdfs.git'\\
To prevent you from losing history, non-fast-forward updates were rejected\\
Merge the remote changes (e.g. 'git pull') before pushing again.  See the\\
'Note about fast-forwards' section of 'git push --help' for details.

}}}

This is a very important push, and I need it to go through.

Please tell me what I can do on my end, or if you've done what's required on yours.

Thanks,

Samuel Marks
fields.summary: Getting an error when trying to push changes [git]

$ wget --verbose --user=XXXXX --password=YYYYY https://bitbucket.org/ekku/REPO/get/tip.zip

https://bitbucket.org/ekku/REPO/get/tip.zip\\
Resolving bitbucket.org... 207.223.240.182, 207.223.240.181\\
Connecting to bitbucket.org|207.223.240.182|:443... connected.

Failed writing HTTP request: Bad file descriptor.\\
Retrying.

fields.description:
Hello, from day ago i can't to push the changes to repository on bitbucket.\\
I'm the admin of account 'sparm_intranet'.

Can't to push in:\\
https://bitbucket.org/sparm_intranet/kiosk2 and https://bitbucket.org/sparm_intranet/sparm_intranet

The IDE Netbeans says:\\
Command: [hg, outgoing, -v, --template=rev:{rev}\nauth:{author}\ndesc:{desc}\ndate:{date|hgdate}\nid:{node|short}\n\nendCS:\n, --repository, /home/sites/intranet/www, http://sparm_intranet:****@bitbucket.org/sparm_intranet/sparm_intranet]\\
Output: [abort: error: Connection timed out]

Using: Netbeans IDE 6.8 and last Mercurial

Is it the problem of your service?\\
PS: I can to browse the site bitbucket.org and ping bitbucket.org.
fields.summary: can't to push the changes to repository

fields.description:
I don't know if this is specific to HipChat, but that's where I've observed this. When using the HipChat integration, we get messages in the chat that look like this when people push to a repo:

{{{\\
juri committed to my-branch at /user/repo/

* Commit that actually went to my-branch (123456789abc)
* Commit that went to completely-different-branch (123456789abd)\\
}}}

The branch mentioned on the first line is the branch of the first commit in the push. That can be pretty misleading if the commits after that went to different branches and just happened to be pushed at the same time. It would be nice to get headings between the commit messages where the branches change.
fields.summary: hipchat integration: pushes with commits to multiple branches look confusing (BB-2942)

fields.description:
The link to associated changesets incorrectly includes the username in the URL when you are using a custom domain.

See attached screenshot:
fields.summary: Incorrect link to changeset from "Issues" when using a custom domain

fields.description: I have stopped receiving checkin notification e-mails. The last e-mail was received on October 22, and none after that. This is true for all the repositories under this account.
fields.summary: Email notifications stopped working (BB-2937)

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm new with Bitbucket. I created a git repository then cloned it successfully !

Since I tried to create a ssh key and upload it, I can not connect to the repository anymore ...

I get this message:

$ git clone git@bitbucket.org:username/repo.git\\
Cloning into repo...\\
Permission denied (publickey).\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly

I also tried {{{ssh -v git@bitbucket.org}}} and i got :

{{{\\
OpenSSH_4.6p1, OpenSSL 0.9.8e 23 Feb 2007\\
debug1: Connecting to bitbucket.org [207.223.240.181] port 22.\\
debug1: Connection established.\\
debug1: identity file /c/Users/username/.ssh/identity type -1\\
debug1: identity file /c/Users/username/.ssh/id_rsa type -1\\
debug1: identity file /c/Users/username/.ssh/id_dsa type -1\\
debug1: Remote protocol version 2.0, remote software version OpenSSH_5.3\\
debug1: match: OpenSSH_5.3 pat OpenSSH*\\
debug1: Enabling compatibility mode for protocol 2.0\\
debug1: Local version string SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_4.6\\
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEXINIT sent\\
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEXINIT received\\
debug1: kex: server->client aes128-cbc hmac-md5 none\\
debug1: kex: client->server aes128-cbc hmac-md5 none\\
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_REQUEST(1024<1024<8192) sent\\
debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_GROUP\\
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_INIT sent\\
debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_REPLY\\
debug1: Host 'bitbucket.org' is known and matches the RSA host key.\\
debug1: Found key in /c/Users/username/.ssh/known_hosts:1\\
debug1: ssh_rsa_verify: signature correct\\
debug1: SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS sent\\
debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS\\
debug1: SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS received\\
debug1: SSH2_MSG_SERVICE_REQUEST sent\\
debug1: SSH2_MSG_SERVICE_ACCEPT received\\
debug1: Authentications that can continue: publickey\\
debug1: Next authentication method: publickey\\
debug1: Trying private key: /c/Users/username/.ssh/identity\\
debug1: Trying private key: /c/Users/username/.ssh/id_rsa\\
debug1: Trying private key: /c/Users/Maxime/.ssh/id_dsa\\
debug1: No more authentication methods to try.\\
Permission denied (publickey).\\
}}}

Can someone help me ? Is there any way to have the repository access without key needed ?

Thanks,\\
Maxime.
fields.summary: SSH KEYS ISSUE

fields.summary: Cannot delete Issue tracker and wiki

fields.description:
The logout button seems to have disappeared, or at least it's now well-hidden. This is bad news for several reasons, not least because it makes it difficult to navigate between different userids.

I have given this a "critical" priority because in a couple of weeks, I will be giving a public talk in which I'd like to show how Bitbucket can be used, and this is a critical piece of functionality for my talk.
fields.summary: Logout

fields.description: Its silly to follow self. Why does bitbucket allow follow self?
fields.summary: You should not be able to follow yourself (BB-2924)
